nearby_text.text: 3.  ACC  HDR   Male  Header      The   Ã-pin   ACC  HDR  power  breakout  header  is  used  to  connect  the  common    ÆV   USB  supply  directly  to  every   ÆV   pin  on  the  edge  expansion  headers.           The  P Ã-EV AL  board  is  supplied  with  the  jumper  located  on  the   ÆV   pin  only,    and  not  connected  to  the  ACC  HDR  pin.  This  is  the  “OFF”  position,  and    means  that  power  is  not  routed  from  the   ÆV   output  pin  to  each  of  the  edge    headers  via  the  ACC  HDR  pin.         To  enable  the   ÆV   supply  at  the  edge  headers,  move  the  jumper  across  both  pins  to  join    them  together.  Certain  accessory  boards  require  a   ÆV   supply,  such  as  the  USB  accessory    part-number   ÇÅÁÁÇ-E S ¥b¦.          For  experimentation,  the  jumper  could  be  removed  and  an  external  power  source  or    inline  current  meter  connected  here  instead. PC   86B   P RUW        The  microUSB  PC  USB  port  can  perform  the  following  functions:     ● Load  programs  from  a  computer  into  the  Propeller   Ã   microcontroller     ● Support  serial-over-USB  communications  to  a  terminal  program  on  a  computer     ● Supply   Æ   V  power  from  a  computer’s  USB  port

2.  LDO   9IN   Male  Header      The   Ã-pin   LDO  VIN  power  breakout  header  is  used  to  connect  the  common   ÆV   USB  supply    to  the   Ä.ÄV   LDO  regulators  powering  VIO,  microSD  card,  and  flash  memory  chip.           In  normal  use  a  jumper  would  be  connected  across  the   Ã-pin   header.    For    experimentation,  the  jumper  could  be  removed  and  an  external  power    source  or  inline  current  meter  could  be  connected  here,  instead. nearby_text.text: 11 D.   I/O  P LQ   B UHDNRXW   E GJH   H HDGHUV   ( ZLWKRXW   5 9                    RXWSXW)      There  are  two  edge  headers  which  do  not  have   ÆV   routed  to                           them.         The  header  for  P ÃÅ   to  P ÄÂ   is  shown  with  a  white  silk  square  for                             the  pin  beside  the  Vxxxx  pin.  This  unlabelled  pin  is                       unconnected,  but  could  be  used  for  connecting  a  user  signal  or                        voltage  to  a  user  accessory  board  or  prototype  board.

When  power  is  connected  to  AUX  USB,  this  will  automatically  take  priority  over  power                              from  the  lower  current  PC-USB  port.  The  AUX  USB  port  includes  protection  that  will                               disable  the  supply  if   ÃA   current  draw  is  exceeded.         When  a  short-circuit,  over-current  or  over-temperature  fault  condition  is  detected  by  the                         USB  protection  circuit  ,  power  will  be  disconnected «   and  the  corresponding  fault  LED,                           marked  by  a  warning  triangle  label,  will  light  until  the  fault  is  remedied.         «   N ]j e    P ]q e g   di hc][[ecji][    ]cckgh   a j    jhe   E p al  b ]ag d  USB   dg]j ec ji][   ci g c kij   The                             Auxiliary  power  header  pads   are  located  before  that  protection  circuit  because  they  are                             in  parallel  with  the  Aux  USB  Port  to  provide  both  a  power  input  and  output.  As  such,                                    when  power  disconnection  occurs  in  a  fault  condition,  the  Auxiliary  power  header  pads                            will  be  able  to  continue  sourcing  power.

nearby_text.text: The  header  for  P ÆÇ   to  P ÇÄ   has  the  RES  pin  beside  the  V ÆÇÇÄ     pin.  The  RES  pin  is  active  low,  and  is  connected  to  the  Propeller    Ã   microcontroller  RESn  circuit.  Momentarily  set  this  pin  low  to    reset  the  Propeller.  This  header  is  ideal  for  connecting  to  a  WiFi    module   ¥such   as  the  Parallax  WX  Module  :    https://www.parallax.com/product/ ÄÃÅÃÁs  ¦,   in  order  to    program  the  Propeller   Ã   wirelessly. 12.  LED  B DQN      This  bank  of  eight  LEDs  is  connected  via  an   LED  Buffer   to  pins  P ÆÇ   through  P ÇÄ.   The                                     buffer  isolates  the  LEDs  so  they  will  not  influence  the  I/O  signals.  P ÆÇ-PÇÄ   LEDs  are                                 connected  to  the  USB  data  and  P Ã   memory  signals   ¥see    I/O  Pin  Assignments  ¦   so  these                                 LEDs  will  be  especially  active  at  power-up  and  after  a  reset.
